jobDescription: EgenciaEach year Egencia helps thousands of companies in over 60 markets better manage their travel programs. We provide modern solutions and exceptional service to millions of travelers as they plan, take and complete every business trip. We deliver bottom-line savings to our clients and support the needs of the modern business traveler.  Do you want a great role working in what is a very new space for B2B travel with the chance of great ownership and the opportunity to lead change? Then the Data Scientist (Lead Analyst) position might be just what you are looking for!  As Data Scientist (Lead Analyst) working for Egencia you will work as part of Egencias Commercial Analytics team and will support and influence decisions based on data and insightful analyses to help achieve our objectives, using advanced analytical techniques. You will be working through complex business problems, partnering with internal clients using a consultative approach, working up to executive level. What will you do:Work with the Commercial Analytics Director to translate proposals into analytic work plansSales & marketing analytics including but not limited to: Customer Segmentation (Cluster or Factor Analysis), Retention Analysis, Lifetime Value Analysis, Customer Profiles, Market Research, predictive modeling, financial modeling, survey analysisExecute analysis based on a delivery plan crafted by the teamParticipate and support in delivering results and presentations to clientsPerform hands-on analysis of large volumes of transaction and customer level data (cookie data) work with complex data structures, manipulate, cleanse data and perform statistical analysisCreate case studies to promote the Analytics expertiseWho are you / what you have:Solid knowledge in machine learning techniques such as Bayesian methods, clustering, decision trees, random forests, NLP etc., with experience in selecting features, building and optimizing, supervised versus unsupervisedExcellent problem-solving skills, self-motivation and the capacity to work under pressure and tight deadlinesExcellent verbal, written communication, and data presentation skillsAdvanced educational qualification in, and experience with, statistical modelling & analysis, complex computational methods & techniques is highly desirableAdvanced data access and extraction tools and methods, e.g., R, Python, SAS, SQL, OLAP, etc.Familiarity with current technologies, e.g., Redshift, Qubole for large data set storage, processing and analysis is desirableExtraordinary analytical skills - likely to have been honed through relevant work experience in an analytical roleProven Experience of implementing/running Analytics and Data Mining projectsAn advanced degree (post graduate Masters, Ph.D., etc.) in a quantitative field or sufficient experienceWho are we: We believe in being Different. We seek new ideas, different ways of thinking, diverse backgrounds and approaches, because averages can lie and sameness is dangerous. Because of this belief, our norms aren't rules or universal at all corners of our company. But they are important to our identity and how we work together. Like our company, these norms will evolve.  We are Transparent. We communicate openly and honestly, at all levels, upwards, sideways and downwards. We surface difficult issues quickly, we act, we learn.  We organize for Speed. We seek to gather data as fast as possible, and move. Speed allows us to make mistakes and constantly improve.  We believe in the Scientific Method. Everyones ideas are equal in the face of hard data. We use data to guide but not define our actions.  We Lead Humbly. Our leaders serve their teams. None of us has all of the answers, but we are curious and we are always looking to learn. Though our leaders take their responsibilities to our business and their teams incredibly seriously, they never take themselves too seriously.  We act as One Team. We look to optimize for the greater good, not just our own, or even our own teams' interests. We are actively interested in the success of others.
